intro: Delphinium kandaharicum, commonly known as Kandahar larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features tall, erect stems that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, adorned with clusters of striking blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
